ilo: Analyse models and theories of emergent language and literacy development to demonstrate an understanding of the concepts, substance and structure of language and literacy learning from birth to 8 years of age, including play-based learning.
Synthesize understandings of early language and literacy development, appropriate pedagogical practices and curriculum planning, to set goals that challenge all learners.
Critique, select, use and evaluate resources, including ICT, appropriate for the teaching of early reading and writing for diverse learners.
Plan, structure, sequence, assess, evaluate and modify learning programs based on recent research into early language and literacy development and on diverse learning needs.
Plan learning experiences that use a range of verbal and non-verbal communication strategies to manage and support student participation and promote engagement in learning.
generic_skills: Responsiveness to a changing knowledge base.

Inherent requirements (core participatio.content: Further details on how to seek academic adjustments can be found on the Student Equity and Disability Support website:http://services.unimelb.edu.au/student-equity/home

assessment.brief: Literature Review: An analysis and synthesis of the literature on early language and literacy development
Unit of Work Development: Unit of work using a rich text to support language and literacy learning

assessment.hurdle: A minimum of 80% attendance at, or engagement with, all sessions identified as contact hours (may include lectures, tutorials, seminars and workshops, both synchronous and asynchronous).

date_times.contact_hours: 24 hours (16 hours of on campus classes and 8 hours of asynchronous online activities)
